Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.

P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: hhs.texas.gov/PEBT

TEA has redesigned the Confidential Student Reports (CSRs) that explain your child’s performance on the State of Texas Assessment of Academic Readiness or STAAR test for the 2017 Spring testing season. The CSR's will be mailed from the district in July.

Parents can access their child’s performance results online at the Texas Assessment Data Portal website using the portal code on a past year's CSR or by clicking "Look up access code" and entering the students first name, PIEMS ID # (Student Social Security Number) and birth date. https://txparentportal.emetric.net/login?returnUrl=/list
If you need assistance, please contact the school office that your student attends.
Thank you!

post_text: 19 Bland Elementary School students participated in their first Robotics Competition in Bonham on Saturday. Team 2 was ranked 12 out of 37 teams after qualifying matches. They racked up 97 total points, which guaranteed them a spot in the finals. They tied for 6th place in the finals. Team 1 was ranked 27 out of 37 teams after qualifying matches. They accumulated 57 points after qualifying matches. Both teams competed well and Team 1 was one of only 12 teams that made it to the finals. We are VERY proud of how hard our students worked and their demonstration of good behavior and sportsmanship throughout the day. Bland students are the best!
